Username: Dojo Five: Modern Embedded DevelopmentDojo Five: Modern Embedded Development
Post Content:
Setting up Jenkins for embedded projects?You’ve got two choices:Do it rightOr suffer the consequencesWe’ve seen it too often—fragile pipelines, wasted hours, unreliable builds.Good news: it doesn’t have to be that way.This blog walks through best practices for CI/CD in embedded using Jenkins, from toolchains to environment variables.Don’t just automate—stabilize and scale.💡 Get the guide: https://hubs.la/Q03gP7Ky0



…more

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart



…more

🚀 Passion. Precision. Reliability. — The core values that fuel every line of code, every deployment, and every system I help scale.As a DevOps & Site Reliability Engineer, I thrive at the intersection of automation, scalability, and stability. The joy of solving complex infrastructure challenges and ensuring 99.99% uptime isn’t just part of my job—it’s what drives me.💡 With the ever-evolving landscape of cloud-native tools and platform engineering, I stay deeply engaged with the latest trends—like platform engineering as a service, AI-enhanced observability, and the growing shift toward GitOps-first infrastructures.🔍 I’ve been exploring powerful innovations like:🔧 Crossplane – the future of multi-cloud infrastructure as code📊 OpenTelemetry – redefining how we trace and monitor distributed systems🤖 AI in CI/CD – reducing mean time to resolution with predictive intelligence💬 I’m always open to collaborating, learning, and exchanging ideas with fellow engineers and builders in the DevOps & SRE community. If you share this passion, let’s connect!📌 And yes—I'm actively looking for new opportunities where I can bring my skills to teams focused on innovation, reliability, and cloud excellence. If you're hiring or just want to chat DevOps, I’d love to hear from you.Let’s build the future—one pipeline at a time. 🚀hashtag#DevOps hashtag#SiteReliabilityEngineer hashtag#SRE hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode hashtag#CloudEngineering hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Terraform hashtag#Observability hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#LetsConnect hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#DevOpsCulture



…more

Hey LinkedIn, I’m open to new opportunities!I’m Vijaya Prashanth Mukiri, a Senior Azure Data Engineer with 10+ years in data engineering, cloud architecture, and real-time analytics.I’ve had the chance to work on some pretty exciting stuff:✅ Built large-scale ETL & ELT pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Synapse, and Databricks✅ Developed real-time streaming systems using Kafka + Spark Streaming✅ Designed robust lakehouse architectures using Delta Lake & Azure Data Lake Gen2✅ Automated CI/CD with Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitOps, and worked in containerized environments with AKS✅ Created business-critical dashboards and insights with Power BI, DAX, and Microsoft Fabric✅ Strong in Python, PySpark, SQL, Scala, and Shell scripting✅ Focused on performance tuning, data governance (Purview), and secure deployments (Key Vault, Private Link)Industries I’ve worked in: Banking, Healthcare, Retail, FinanceTools I love: Databricks, Azure Synapse, Spark, Kafka, Power BICertifications: Azure Data Engineer Associate | Databricks CertifiedRight now, I’m actively looking for C2C or C2H roles where I can contribute to building scalable, secure, and intelligent data platforms.If you’re hiring — or know someone who is — let’s connect!Contact:vijayaprashanthmukiri@gmail.com+1-731-433-0407https://lnkd.in/eBpVCetDhashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#AzureDataEngineer hashtag#Databricks hashtag#Kafka hashtag#PowerBI hashtag#CloudDataEngineering hashtag#BigData hashtag#ETL hashtag#StreamingData hashtag#AzureDevOps

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

🚀 Passion. Precision. Reliability. — The core values that fuel every line of code, every deployment, and every system I help scale.As a DevOps & Site Reliability Engineer, I thrive at the intersection of automation, scalability, and stability. The joy of solving complex infrastructure challenges and ensuring 99.99% uptime isn’t just part of my job—it’s what drives me.💡 With the ever-evolving landscape of cloud-native tools and platform engineering, I stay deeply engaged with the latest trends—like platform engineering as a service, AI-enhanced observability, and the growing shift toward GitOps-first infrastructures.🔍 I’ve been exploring powerful innovations like:🔧 Crossplane – the future of multi-cloud infrastructure as code📊 OpenTelemetry – redefining how we trace and monitor distributed systems🤖 AI in CI/CD – reducing mean time to resolution with predictive intelligence💬 I’m always open to collaborating, learning, and exchanging ideas with fellow engineers and builders in the DevOps & SRE community. If you share this passion, let’s connect!📌 And yes—I'm actively looking for new opportunities where I can bring my skills to teams focused on innovation, reliability, and cloud excellence. 🚀 EPAM is Hiring: Lead Developer - Microsoft Dynamics 365!📍 Location: Hyderabad, India👨‍💻 About the Role: We are seeking an experienced Lead Developer for Microsoft Dynamics 365 to oversee and drive the development and customization of Dynamics CRM solutions within our organization. As a key leader, you will guide the team in delivering high-quality solutions that align with business needs and ensure seamless integration with external systems.If you are passionate about Dynamics CRM development and thrive in a collaborative, Agile environment, we encourage you to apply and make an impact!🎯 Responsibilities:• Lead the development and customization of MS Dynamics CRM products.• Design, test, and implement MS Dynamics CRM Plugins using C#.• Implement customizations using .Net C#, PCF, Workflows, Actions, Custom • APIs, and Power Automate Flows.• Integrate MS Dynamics CRM with external systems.• Manage CI/CD pipelines using tools like Git, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps.• Oversee environment elevations of Dynamics solutions and data.• Collaborate with teams to continuously improve processes under Agile practices.• Maintain knowledge of MS Dynamics CRM online out-of-the-box functionality.• Ensure adherence to best practices in unit testing concepts.🎓 Requirements:• 8-16 years of work experience.• Minimum 5 years of development and customization experience in MS Dynamics CRM products.• Proficiency in developing MS Dynamics CRM Plugins with C# and customizations using .Net C#, PCF, Workflows, Actions, Custom APIs, and Power Automate Flows.• Expertise in CI/CD, Git, Jenkins, and/or Azure DevOps.• Background in MS Dynamics CRM integrations with external systems.• Strong understanding of unit testing concepts and Agile practices.• Advanced level of spoken English.🌟 Nice to Have:• Development experience with WCF and WebAPI.• Knowledge of .NET Core and ASP.NET Core.• Development experience with ASP.NET MVC.• Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, Angular 2, or React.• Experience with cloud services, including MS Azure Services (App Service, Service Bus) or Amazon Web Services.⚡ Join EPAM to work on cutting-edge projects, collaborate with talented professionals, and grow your career in a supportive and innovative environment. Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

𝑩𝒖𝒕 𝒘𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒎𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒔 𝒊𝒕 𝒔𝒐 𝒂𝒑𝒑𝒆𝒂𝒍𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒐 𝒅𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒍𝒐𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒔? 𝑳𝒆𝒕'𝒔 𝒃𝒓𝒆𝒂𝒌 𝒊𝒕 𝒅𝒐𝒘𝒏.𝐏𝐞𝐫𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐬𝐦Go delivers high performance due to its statically typed and compiled nature. Its built-in support for parallelism through goroutines and channels enables the creation of scalable and responsive systems that can handle high loads. This is particularly important for cloud infrastructures, where efficient task distribution is critical.𝐂𝐫𝐨𝐬𝐬-𝐏𝐥𝐚𝐭𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐜𝐢𝐭𝐲Go is a cross-platform language, meaning developers can create executable files for various operating systems, such as UNIX, Linux, and Windows, without extra effort. Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Crush Your Next Interview: 3 Proven Prep Strategies That WorkI. Analyze the interviewer in advance by copying 10 posts from LinkedIn and pasting into 'intelligence' (chatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to decipher their personality.II. Analyze how to build rapport with them.  Again, utilize 'intelligence' combined with your own intellectual know-how.III. Analyze the job description, your resume, and the analysis from above along with 3 of your best challenge/action/result stories.  Use 'intelligence' to assist you but craft undeniable stories from your authentic voice.  These stories/scripts should be less than 2 minutes long and succinct in delivery. Bonus:  Record your interview scripts.  Play them back listening to audio only (no video), video (no audio), and finally review the transcript and identify all words that don't add any value. Here's an example we used for one of my clients recently who had 2 interviews for a role.Jane Doe — Product & Engineering Leader, Data-Driven, Reserved CommunicatorJane's focus:➤ She leads Digital Payments Product and is embedded in UX/UI, product lifecycle, dashboards, and API integration.➤ She values cross-functional product thinking, end-to-end delivery, and data-backed execution.➤ She’s product-centric, with strong roots in DevOps, design thinking, microservices, and product analytics.What she is likely assessing:➤ How you enable predictable, high-quality delivery of Product features.➤ Your partnership model with Product teams, especially when building dashboards and reporting pipelines.➤ How you ensure product teams are “working on the right things.”How to prepare:➤ Come ready with 1–2 examples of launching product features where he partnered with product managers and UX teams, particularly if dashboards/reporting/analytics were involved.➤ Be able to speak to how he drives agile hygiene, data cleanliness, sprint scope and delivery.➤ Reinforce ownership mindset...not just delivery of what’s asked, but questioning and shaping what gets prioritized.Strong phrases to use:➤ “We built joint dashboards across product and tech to track scope completion and backlog health.”➤ “One thing I emphasize is product telemetry and using feedback loops early.”Personality Signals:➤ Doesn’t post much on LinkedIn beyond hiring... suggests she’s focused, introverted, or time-sensitive.➤ Has a strong technical foundation (APIs, AWS, CI/CD, design thinking) and delivery mindset.Rapport Strategy:Break the ice with a mutual appreciation for product/tech collaboration.Ex: “I noticed your background spans both product and engineering... I’ve always found that’s where the magic happens. That kind of dual lens really resonates with how I like to work.”Tone: Low-key, prepared, outcome-oriented. Avoid “selling” too hard — show competence and partnership.Would you like the AI formula?  Comment "formula" below.hashtag#interview hashtag#interviewing hashtag#interviews

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Crush Your Next Interview: 3 Proven Prep Strategies That WorkI. Analyze the interviewer in advance by copying 10 posts from LinkedIn and pasting into 'intelligence' (chatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to decipher their personality.II. Analyze how to build rapport with them.  Again, utilize 'intelligence' combined with your own intellectual know-how.III. Analyze the job description, your resume, and the analysis from above along with 3 of your best challenge/action/result stories.  Use 'intelligence' to assist you but craft undeniable stories from your authentic voice.  These stories/scripts should be less than 2 minutes long and succinct in delivery. Bonus:  Record your interview scripts.  Play them back listening to audio only (no video), video (no audio), and finally review the transcript and identify all words that don't add any value. Here's an example we used for one of my clients recently who had 2 interviews for a role.Jane Doe — Product & Engineering Leader, Data-Driven, Reserved CommunicatorJane's focus:➤ She leads Digital Payments Product and is embedded in UX/UI, product lifecycle, dashboards, and API integration.➤ She values cross-functional product thinking, end-to-end delivery, and data-backed execution.➤ She’s product-centric, with strong roots in DevOps, design thinking, microservices, and product analytics.What she is likely assessing:➤ How you enable predictable, high-quality delivery of Product features.➤ Your partnership model with Product teams, especially when building dashboards and reporting pipelines.➤ How you ensure product teams are “working on the right things.”How to prepare:➤ Come ready with 1–2 examples of launching product features where he partnered with product managers and UX teams, particularly if dashboards/reporting/analytics were involved.➤ Be able to speak to how he drives agile hygiene, data cleanliness, sprint scope and delivery.➤ Reinforce ownership mindset...not just delivery of what’s asked, but questioning and shaping what gets prioritized.Strong phrases to use:➤ “We built joint dashboards across product and tech to track scope completion and backlog health.”➤ “One thing I emphasize is product telemetry and using feedback loops early.”Personality Signals:➤ Doesn’t post much on LinkedIn beyond hiring... suggests she’s focused, introverted, or time-sensitive.➤ Has a strong technical foundation (APIs, AWS, CI/CD, design thinking) and delivery mindset.Rapport Strategy:Break the ice with a mutual appreciation for product/tech collaboration.Ex: “I noticed your background spans both product and engineering... I’ve always found that’s where the magic happens. That kind of dual lens really resonates with how I like to work.”Tone: Low-key, prepared, outcome-oriented. Avoid “selling” too hard — show competence and partnership.Would you like the AI formula?  Comment "formula" below.hashtag#interview hashtag#interviewing hashtag#interviews

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Crush Your Next Interview: 3 Proven Prep Strategies That WorkI. Analyze the interviewer in advance by copying 10 posts from LinkedIn and pasting into 'intelligence' (chatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to decipher their personality.II. Analyze how to build rapport with them.  Again, utilize 'intelligence' combined with your own intellectual know-how.III. Analyze the job description, your resume, and the analysis from above along with 3 of your best challenge/action/result stories.  Use 'intelligence' to assist you but craft undeniable stories from your authentic voice.  These stories/scripts should be less than 2 minutes long and succinct in delivery. Bonus:  Record your interview scripts.  Play them back listening to audio only (no video), video (no audio), and finally review the transcript and identify all words that don't add any value. Here's an example we used for one of my clients recently who had 2 interviews for a role.Jane Doe — Product & Engineering Leader, Data-Driven, Reserved CommunicatorJane's focus:➤ She leads Digital Payments Product and is embedded in UX/UI, product lifecycle, dashboards, and API integration.➤ She values cross-functional product thinking, end-to-end delivery, and data-backed execution.➤ She’s product-centric, with strong roots in DevOps, design thinking, microservices, and product analytics.What she is likely assessing:➤ How you enable predictable, high-quality delivery of Product features.➤ Your partnership model with Product teams, especially when building dashboards and reporting pipelines.➤ How you ensure product teams are “working on the right things.”How to prepare:➤ Come ready with 1–2 examples of launching product features where he partnered with product managers and UX teams, particularly if dashboards/reporting/analytics were involved.➤ Be able to speak to how he drives agile hygiene, data cleanliness, sprint scope and delivery.➤ Reinforce ownership mindset...not just delivery of what’s asked, but questioning and shaping what gets prioritized.Strong phrases to use:➤ “We built joint dashboards across product and tech to track scope completion and backlog health.”➤ “One thing I emphasize is product telemetry and using feedback loops early.”Personality Signals:➤ Doesn’t post much on LinkedIn beyond hiring... suggests she’s focused, introverted, or time-sensitive.➤ Has a strong technical foundation (APIs, AWS, CI/CD, design thinking) and delivery mindset.Rapport Strategy:Break the ice with a mutual appreciation for product/tech collaboration.Ex: “I noticed your background spans both product and engineering... I’ve always found that’s where the magic happens. That kind of dual lens really resonates with how I like to work.”Tone: Low-key, prepared, outcome-oriented. Avoid “selling” too hard — show competence and partnership.Would you like the AI formula?  Comment "formula" below.hashtag#interview hashtag#interviewing hashtag#interviews

Recruitment in 2025: Where Ghosts, Unicorns & Infinite Offers Roam Being a recruiter in today's job market,especially in India is like starring in your own suspense thriller. You know the characters (candidates), you think you know the plot (job role), but you're never quite sure how it’s going to end (if they’ll join).Here are a few “fun” challenges we’re all too familiar with these days:1. The Great No-Show Mystery 🏃‍♂️ Candidate confirms the offer, shares documents, talks about their "dream role" and then? Disappears into thin air. Poof! We’re left wondering if they ever existed.2. The 100% Hike Olympics 💸 “Current CTC is 12 LPA, expected is 24 LPA.”Because apparently, inflation hits different when you're switching jobs. Budget? What's that?3. Multi-Offer Juggling Act 🎭 In today’s market, every good candidate has 3-4 offers. And they’ll "get back to you" once they’ve consulted their astrologer, cat, and coffee mug.4. The Myth of the Immediate Joiner 🧘‍♀️Oh yes, I’m available to join immediately, until you realize “immediate” actually means “after my cousin’s wedding and a 45-day notice period.”5. The Resume vs. Reality Show 📄 Resume: AWS expert, Node.js ninja, team leader.Interview: Can’t explain basic concepts. Still waiting for Google to help mid-answer.6. Is This Role Remote? 🏡If the job isn’t remote or hybrid, you’ve already lost half the candidate pool. In 2025, coming to office is apparently a lifestyle choice, not a job requirement.7. Assessment Round: Eternal EditionYou send a simple test. “Will submit it tonight.” It’s been 6 business nights and counting...At Astria Digital , we’re mastering the art of navigating this chaos with patience, a sense of humor, and a lot of coffee. ☕To all fellow recruiters out there, you're not alone. Keep sourcing, keep smiling. Let’s celebrate every closure like it's a festival (because, honestly, it is). 🎉hashtag#HRRecruitment hashtag#HRNightmares hashtag#Recruitmentstruggles hashtag#RecruiterLife hashtag#HiringHumor hashtag#IndianJobMarket hashtag#RecruitmentWoes hashtag#RealTalk hashtag#AstriaDigital hashtag#TalentTales hashtag#WorkWithHeart

From Legacy to Modern DevSecOps: How GitLab Helped Us Transform CI/CD at Scale 🚀As technology leaders, we often face the challenge of maintaining speed, reliability, and security while managing growing complexity. At our organization, this challenge became increasingly evident as we scaled—managing 350+ repositories, 500+ pipelines, and generating over 1 million artifacts using a combination of Bamboo, Bitbucket, and Nexus.It worked—until it didn’t.Our legacy toolchain became a bottleneck. Fragmented systems meant siloed workflows, rising maintenance overhead, and growing security blind spots. We needed an alternative that could not only replace but also modernize our CI/CD ecosystem.That’s where GitLab came in.🛠️ One Platform, One VisionGitLab offered a unified DevSecOps platform that checked every box—pipeline orchestration, SCM, artifact storage, and security scanning—all under one roof. This consolidation allowed us to:* Migrate hundreds of repositories and thousands of pipeline jobs efficiently* Replace legacy CI/CD scripts with modular, reusable GitLab CI templates* Manage artifact lifecycle and retention more intelligently* Streamline developer workflows and reduce cognitive load🔄 The TransformationWith GitLab, we’ve:* Rebuilt 500+ CI/CD pipelines from scratch using scalable templates* Unified version control and pipeline execution into a single tool* Integrated GitLab Container Registry and eliminated the need for a separate artifact repository* Embedded SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and license checks directly into the pipelinesThe result? Faster delivery, improved collaboration, and reduced operational friction.🔐 Security as a First-Class CitizenSecurity was another key driver. GitLab’s native security capabilities meant we didn’t have to stitch together multiple tools. Now, every commit and merge request is automatically scanned for vulnerabilities—shifting security left and giving our developers instant feedback.📊 The Outcome⏱️ Reduced pipeline execution time and overhead🔍 Full traceability from code to production🔐 Proactive vulnerability detection and mitigation📉 Lowered operational and licensing costs💡 Empowered teams with self-service pipelines and visibilityA Future-Proof CI/CD Strategy:Our move to GitLab wasn’t just a migration—it was a reinvention. By modernizing our CI/CD infrastructure, we’ve laid the foundation for agility, security, and scale in the years ahead.If your organization is struggling with outdated DevOps tooling or rising complexity, I highly recommend evaluating GitLab. It's been a game-changer for us.Big kudos to the DevOps team for driving this transformation—special thanks to Dixit Hihoriya for his outstanding technical expertise.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#GitLab hashtag#CI/CD hashtag#DigitalTransformation hashtag#EngineeringLeadership hashtag#Modernization hashtag#DevSecOps hashtag#PlatformEngineering hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#GitlabDuo

Crush Your Next Interview: 3 Proven Prep Strategies That WorkI. Analyze the interviewer in advance by copying 10 posts from LinkedIn and pasting into 'intelligence' (chatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to decipher their personality.II. Analyze how to build rapport with them.  Again, utilize 'intelligence' combined with your own intellectual know-how.III. Analyze the job description, your resume, and the analysis from above along with 3 of your best challenge/action/result stories.  Use 'intelligence' to assist you but craft undeniable stories from your authentic voice.  These stories/scripts should be less than 2 minutes long and succinct in delivery. Bonus:  Record your interview scripts.  Play them back listening to audio only (no video), video (no audio), and finally review the transcript and identify all words that don't add any value. Here's an example we used for one of my clients recently who had 2 interviews for a role.Jane Doe — Product & Engineering Leader, Data-Driven, Reserved CommunicatorJane's focus:➤ She leads Digital Payments Product and is embedded in UX/UI, product lifecycle, dashboards, and API integration.➤ She values cross-functional product thinking, end-to-end delivery, and data-backed execution.➤ She’s product-centric, with strong roots in DevOps, design thinking, microservices, and product analytics.What she is likely assessing:➤ How you enable predictable, high-quality delivery of Product features.➤ Your partnership model with Product teams, especially when building dashboards and reporting pipelines.➤ How you ensure product teams are “working on the right things.”How to prepare:➤ Come ready with 1–2 examples of launching product features where he partnered with product managers and UX teams, particularly if dashboards/reporting/analytics were involved.➤ Be able to speak to how he drives agile hygiene, data cleanliness, sprint scope and delivery.➤ Reinforce ownership mindset...not just delivery of what’s asked, but questioning and shaping what gets prioritized.Strong phrases to use:➤ “We built joint dashboards across product and tech to track scope completion and backlog health.”➤ “One thing I emphasize is product telemetry and using feedback loops early.”Personality Signals:➤ Doesn’t post much on LinkedIn beyond hiring... suggests she’s focused, introverted, or time-sensitive.➤ Has a strong technical foundation (APIs, AWS, CI/CD, design thinking) and delivery mindset.Rapport Strategy:Break the ice with a mutual appreciation for product/tech collaboration.Ex: “I noticed your background spans both product and engineering... I’ve always found that’s where the magic happens. That kind of dual lens really resonates with how I like to work.”Tone: Low-key, prepared, outcome-oriented. Avoid “selling” too hard — show competence and partnership.Would you like the AI formula?  Comment "formula" below.hashtag#interview hashtag#interviewing hashtag#interviews
